title.native: アイドルマスター ゼノグラシア

description:
107 years ago, the Moon was destroyed in a massive cataclysm that shattered Earth's former satellite into 81 quintillion tons of orbital debris. However, thanks to super-science, the Earth itself was saved and today no one really thinks much about that century-past disaster. Which is why when teenage Haruka Amami auditions for something called the Idolmaster Project, she THINKS she's trying out to be a singing idol. Instead, Haruka finds herself at a secret school run by the Mondenkind Agency, living with a group of other girls who have also been selected as candidates to pilot an iDOL - an advanced robot specifically designed to intercept falling chunks of moon rock. Except, the people who run the Mondenkind Agency aren't exactly knights in shining armor. And then there's the question of whether the iDOLs are really JUST robots. Because from almost the first moment, Haruka starts to feel emotions resonating from within the iDOL called Imber.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

アイドルマスター XENOGLOSSIA

node.description:
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Known to prescore his works.

Studied under [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/) on [JoJo's Bizarre Adventure](https://anilist.co/anime/666/), [Perfect Blue](https://anilist.co/anime/437/) and [Millenium Actress](https://anilist.co/anime/1033/).

__[Website](http://www.spacecraft.co.jp/saito/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/斉藤恒芳)__

__Tsuneyoshi Saito__ is a Japanese composer and arranger. He has composed for several anime series, films, and TV dramas.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gaku3900) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小野学_(アニメーション監督%29)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gaku3900) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小野学_(アニメーション監督%29)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

He made his full directorial debut with the release of [Honey and Clover II](https://anilist.co/anime/1142/Hachimitsu-to-Clover-II/) in 2006, after which he directed [Idolmaster: Xenoglossia](https://anilist.co/anime/1694/Idolmster-Xenoglossia/) in 2007, and [Toradora!](https://anilist.co/anime/4224/Toradora/) in 2008. He has also directed the spin-off series of [Toaru Majutsu no Index](https://anilist.co/anime/4654/Toaru-Majutsu-no-Index/), respectively named [Toaru Kagaku no Railgun](https://anilist.co/anime/6213/Toaru-Kagaku-no-Railgun/), which released in 2009.

He made his full directorial debut with the release of [Honey and Clover II](https://anilist.co/anime/1142/Hachimitsu-to-Clover-II/) in 2006, after which he directed [Idolmaster: Xenoglossia](https://anilist.co/anime/1694/Idolmster-Xenoglossia/) in 2007, and [Toradora!](https://anilist.co/anime/4224/Toradora/) in 2008. He has also directed the spin-off series of [Toaru Majutsu no Index](https://anilist.co/anime/4654/Toaru-Majutsu-no-Index/), respectively named [Toaru Kagaku no Railgun](https://anilist.co/anime/6213/Toaru-Kagaku-no-Railgun/), which released in 2009.

He made his full directorial debut with the release of [Honey and Clover II](https://anilist.co/anime/1142/Hachimitsu-to-Clover-II/) in 2006, after which he directed [Idolmaster: Xenoglossia](https://anilist.co/anime/1694/Idolmster-Xenoglossia/) in 2007, and [Toradora!](https://anilist.co/anime/4224/Toradora/) in 2008. He has also directed the spin-off series of [Toaru Majutsu no Index](https://anilist.co/anime/4654/Toaru-Majutsu-no-Index/), respectively named [Toaru Kagaku no Railgun](https://anilist.co/anime/6213/Toaru-Kagaku-no-Railgun/), which released in 2009.

__Real name:__ Asuka Kato (加藤あすか)

[Website](http://www.spacecraft.co.jp/yuuki_aira/)

A J pop singer attached to the company Lantis. She began her career in 2007 performing in [Yuki Kajura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077)'s [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691) as "FictionJunction ASUKA". She released her debut album- Reflection on July 2, 2008.

Non-anime roles:
Hom-kun in "Atelier Meruru" (VG) (Japanese)
Theme Song Performance (OP/ED) for "Root Double -Before Crime * After Days-" (Visual novel) (Japanese)

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

__[Website](https://akihata.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akihata_jp) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akihata.jp/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/AKIHATAjp)__

__Aki Hata__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/窪岡俊之)

__[Blog (JP)](http://forte-piano.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nijine)__

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Nana Prefectural Sakurai Senior High School (2001), Osaka College of Music (2004)

__Introduction:__
Akito Matsuda, also known by his alias Nijine, is a Japanese composer and arranger. He worked freelance as a composer and arranger until his employment with Popholic found place in 2007.

__Biography:__
Akito is mainly known for working under the name Nijine, which he did between 2006 through 2012, where he wrote the soundtracks for a handful of anime while also composing and arranging various anime songs. In 2013, he decided to start using his real name for his work instead. He is also known for working on several eroge soundtracks and vocal songs under the name Tokia (stylized as TOKIA) early on in his career.

__[Blog (JP)](http://forte-piano.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nijine)__

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Nana Prefectural Sakurai Senior High School (2001), Osaka College of Music (2004)

__Introduction:__
Akito Matsuda, also known by his alias Nijine, is a Japanese composer and arranger. He worked freelance as a composer and arranger until his employment with Popholic found place in 2007.

__Biography:__
Akito is mainly known for working under the name Nijine, which he did between 2006 through 2012, where he wrote the soundtracks for a handful of anime while also composing and arranging various anime songs. In 2013, he decided to start using his real name for his work instead. He is also known for working on several eroge soundtracks and vocal songs under the name Tokia (stylized as TOKIA) early on in his career.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [scriptwriter](https://anilist.co/staff/119169/)._
Married to [Hiroshi Takeuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/118588/).
Married to [Hiroshi Takeuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/118588/).
Debuted as an art director of [Kurau Phantom Memory](https://anilist.co/anime/483/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/codamasaori) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/codamasaori/)
